definition: Something you use to carry things.
A round thing you can throw, catch, or kick.
Pages of stories or information you can read.
A device used to measure and show time, typically found on walls or worn on the wrist.
An animal that has wings and can fly.
A furry animal that barks and is a good friend to humans.
An animal that lives in water and swims.
A small animal with a long tail, often found in houses.
A tool you use to pick up and eat your food. It has a handle and usually four pointy parts called prongs.
A flat round thing you put your food on when you eat.
A tool with a round scoop at the end. You use it to eat soup or cereal.
A long yellow fruit that is soft inside. It's sweet and you can peel it to eat.
The part of your body at the end of your leg that you stand and walk on.
The part of your body on the side of your head that you hear with.
The part of your body you see with.
The thin strands that grow on your head.
The top part of your body that has your eyes, nose, mouth, and brain.
The tiny hairs that grow on the edge of your eyelids.
The part of your body that connects your head to the rest of your body.
The soft edges around your mouth that you use to close it, talk, and eat.
The part of your leg that bends so you can sit, jump, and run. It's right in the middle of your leg.
The part of your body from your shoulders to your hips that is on the opposite side of your chest. It helps you stand up straight.
A game where you fit pieces together to make a picture or complete a challenge.
Using colors to make pictures or designs on a surface.
A fun thing to do by yourself or with friends with rules and goals.
A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.
